title.narrative: PLANNING, MONITORING&EVALUATION, COORDINATION

description.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan, monitor and evaluate programmes with focus on cross-cutting issues of gender equality, climate change/disaster risk reduction disability conflict sensitivity., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation, Evaluation And Research, Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Sri Lanka Country Programme is effectively and efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children.

participating-org.narrative: PROVINCIAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION UVA PROVINCE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan, monitor and evaluate programmes withfocus on cross-cutting issues of gender equality, climate change/disaster risk reduction; disability; conflict sensitivity.

description.narrative: UNICEF Sri Lanka made significant progress in developing the new Country Programme (CP) for 2023-2027, together with Government, key civil society organizations and other partners. The country office prepared and is implementing a road map for the development of the new CP, which included various milestones needed to ensure that the CP is informed by evidence, consultations both internally and with key stakeholders and lessons learned from the ongoing programme. The country office is also ensuring that the new CP is closely aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework (2023-2027) and is playing a key role in its development | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2022
